You should have a plan for any disaster. Your basic steps should be:

		•Learn evacuation routes. Contact your local officials and find out how you should get out of your area, if you need to.

		•With your family or household members, discuss how to prepare and respond to different types of emergencies that are most likely to occur where you live.

		•Identify responsibilities for each member of your household and how you will work together as a team.

		•Practice as many elements of your plan as possible.

For disaster-specific information, check out the corresponding links in the drop-down menu.
